slides.markdown:
var MyView = Backbone.View.extend({
  tagName: "myElement",
  events: {
    "click .login": "doLogin"
  },
  initialize: function() {
    this.listenTo(this.model, "change", this.render);
  },
  doLogin: function() {
    // Log me in...
  },
  render: function() {
    // Render my view...
  }
});

slides.markdown:
@dark: #010101;
@light: #f1f1f1;

.generic-content {
  background-color: @dark;
  color: @light;
}
.box {
  background-color: saturate(@dark, 5%);
  color: darkenen(@light, 5%);
}

components.text:
Hard to write (Boiler plate alert!)
Hard to maintain
Fragile & Slow
Break your mental model

• Encapsulated components

  • Virtual DOM

  • Unidirectional data flow

  • Optional JSX for markup

1. State change (but not to the DOM)

2a. Compare the rendered output to...
2b. ...the Virtual DOM via a diff op

3. Replaces only what's changed

= Faster!

• Bristol
  • San Francisco

• Bristol
  • Las Vegas
  • London

• Bristol
  • San Francisco

• Bristol
  • Las Vegas
  • London

• Encourages clean encapsulated components
  • Reusability win!
  • No browser required, runs on Node
  • = Isomorphic Javascript Applications
  • React Native (iOS, Android coming soon...)

var App = React.createClass({
  render: function() {
    return (
      <TabBarIOS>
        <TabBarIOS.Item title="React Native" selected={true}>
          <NavigatorIOS initialRoute={{ title: 'React Native' }} />
        </TabBarIOS.Item>
      </TabBarIOS>

$.ajax({
  url: "server/end/point",
}).done(function(response) {
  // Process and hand off to application
});

// GET http://www.example.com/users
// GET http://www.example.com/users/123
// GET http://www.example.com/comments

// GET http://www.example.com/comments/123
{
  forename: "David"
  surname: "Smith",
  dob: 25
}

components.text:
1. Data needs of a component are an internal requirement
     = I need the data I'm displaying/using

2. Components data needs are composable

3. Components requirements dictate the data structure

4. Transfer over the wire only what you need

slides.markdown:
{ // Query
  user(id: 3500401) {
    id,
    name,
    profilePicture(size: 50)  {
      uri,
      width,
      height
    }
  }
}

{ // Result
  "user" : {
    "id": 3500401,
    "name": "Jing Chen",
    "profilePicture": {
      "uri": "http://someurl.cdn/pic.jpg",
      "width": 50,
      "height": 50
    }
  }
}
